Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice, but if you can do better, you should”
Reviews.Author: Daniel V
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel, but I think there should be better hotels in Mexico City, but it's not a bad choice. Nice room and breakfast service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: SouthCarolinaAle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the week of Orgullo Mexico and the staff as well as the hotel were wonderful !. Room was kind of small but very clean and with a beatufil view of the city from the balcony. There was a young lady at the reception when we checked in and She was very polite and friendly. She helped us to solve an issue with our reservation in the most pleasant way ! I will definetly stay at the hotel the next time that I go to Mexico !. By the way It is also very secure because it is located next to a Police Station that is open 24 hours .You can go out at night and just walk to the Hotel because all the Zona Rosa night life is within walking distance from the Hotel. That is a great PLUS . Thank you to all the staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy rooms, uncorteus staff, non amicable, rude, worst cook for dinner ever, poor service, never will stay at Century.”
Reviews.Author: giseladuverney
Reviews.Content: FIRST IMPRESSION COUNT! Ladies working in the Counter were RUDE and did even tried to solve any of our problems we might have as a guest. Fitness center and pool were not working, elevator did not go to floor 22 where the pool is, room were nothing what picture shows, they were not clean enough, we had to asked to wash our comforter and the matress mwas worn out on both sides, carpet were filthy, we had to change rooms, not robes in the bathrooms as promised, no coffee as promised, "AC/ and Heater" was controlled by hotel, there is not termostate on the bedrooms, so if you are not confortable with the temperature cold or hot, there is nothing you can do. Breakfast included, was ok. however, they do NOT CHANGE MENU. Dinner COOK, was the WORST ever. They do NOT honor coupons that you may present. Only good services were, our breakfast waiter and the room maid. "WE WILL NOT STAY AT CENTURY ZONA ROSA, EVER AGAIN. AND DO NOT RECOMMEND ANYBODY TO STAY THERE EITHER". IF YOU WANT TO STAY IN ZONA ROSA, AND NEED A HOTEL WITH A BUDGET GO accross the street "NH HOTEL" or next door BEST WESTERN ROYAL", great service, same price, same location, great building and decoration, and amicable service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, balconies in most rooms, near great food and transportation”
Reviews.Author: steelforce
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the choice of this hotel. The staff went out of it's way to make our group comfortable. restaurant was ok but nothing spectacular. If you want vegetarian food they have it. safe area lots of restaurants and clubs.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ticoSanJose
Reviews.Content: Good hotel Good location, the room was small but very comfortable Very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Price, Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mcbish
Reviews.Content: We are a couple and a teenage boy. This is the second time we choose Century Hotel and all was the same as a year before. One of the elevators is always out of service but beside that, all is wonderful there. This time was floor 17th. The room has a decent space to take a coffee next to a great view to Liverpool street and you can see many buidings from there. The bathroom is good, has a big round tube with shower and many towels to use. No noise from the aisle or other rooms but some pours from the streets, because of its splendid location. We book it on advance and this time we asked for a buffet breakfast, which was a better choice. Coffee, chocolate, croissants, yogurth, juices, ham, cheese, all was good and you can pick whatever you want. The people of the buffet was beyond kind to us. They also have a free Internet connection. There's a lot of shops around including restaurants, bars, antiques and souvenirs. There's a great cd and dvd store two blocks away and another big book store, just ask on the desk. With the Angel of the Independence, the Chapultepec Park (the Anthropology Museum, Zoo, Gardens, etc) a couple of blocks away and every bus and metro available at the same distance, we can't think of a better place to stay in DF. Yes, the "zocalo" (historical district) is somehow far, but at night this is a better zone to stay and walk around and you can take the Metro which is just a block away... or even a bus. Not a single trouble on the streets or in the Metro. Just be careful, don't take big purses or jewels and try to plan your trip in advance. You can go to places as far as Xochimilco just by taking the Metro! We had a wonderful time there... for the second time... and we'd choose it again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: HerbertBeltran
Reviews.Content: No customer oriented. Wanted to increase price after check in. Elevators did not work most of the time, staff unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SactoMike
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Century Zona Rosa in June of 2007. I found it to be very adequate and reasonably priced. Itâ€™s an older hotel but well maintained and clean. The staff is very pleasant and VERY helpful. Some street noise in the room if you get a room in the front street side. The restaurant is very cleanâ€¦.there is someone in there all the time cleaning something. The food is very good, reasonably priced and service is outstanding. It is located in an older part of the city and in the heart of the â€œZona Rosaâ€� (Pink Zone)â€¦Mexico Cityâ€™s Gay district. Public display of affection between same-sex couples is prevalent. Lots of Gay bars, restaurants, shops and sex shops in the area. If any of that offends you then look elsewhere. Hotel is near a Metro (subway) Stationâ€¦about 2 blocks I think. Lots of taxis available outside the hotel. Lots of shopping and good international restaurants in the area. 30 - 40 minutes from the Mexico City International Airportâ€¦taxi fare was $22 USD. Hotel is just 2 blocks from the main drag thru the cityâ€¦ Avenida Reforma. I walked around the area in the late evening and it was a safe place to walk. If youâ€™re thinking about renting a car and driving in the cityâ€¦DONâ€™T. Itâ€™s a city of 26 million people and theyâ€™re all on the streets in cars.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: bscrim
Reviews.Content: dated hotel in a great location: safe walking within zona rosa, metro stop one block away (easy ride to central historic area), plenty of tourist ripoff restaurants, street stalls, sushi, trendy, etc all within few blocks. I didnt eat at the hotel because was I am budget traveler, but looked good and was always busy. friendly staff, cable tv, free internet in lobby. Was popular with tour groups. I had tiny room, but i did request the cheapest they had (US$60) Def had a 70's feel with the decor!! I was never in the room anyway - too much to do and see around there.

Reviews.Title: “ok place esp for tour groups”
Reviews.Author: munizera
Reviews.Content: We were staying here as a group on a xmas time tour of the city; The rooms were standard fare, clean, minifridge, cable tv etc. smallish bathroom; but the restaurant was pretty good, a little slow, If you don't want to eat there there is a Sanborns right down the street. It is typically a little noisy area but no real problems. Rooms have balconies. Within walking distance of restaurants and shopping; just be sure to be back by nightfall or arrange a taxi to take you back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: godofredo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel four nights last February. The location is good since you are close to every shop and restaurant but also you should take into account that it is mostly a gay district. If you are travelling with kids or teens like us you should be aware of this and consider if you will feel comfortable in a place where 90% of people around you are gay couples expressing freely their love in public. The hotel is not a big deal but to me it looked clean and comfortable. My teen daughter thought that it looked a bit like a sex motel just like one of the travellers mentioned. There were hair driers and lock boxes free of charge in the room. There were bubbles, bottled water and other courtesy items from the hotel, too. There wasnâ€™t a clock but you were kindly warned to ask at the reception desk to be woken up in the morning. The maid was very helpful, she offered to make our rooms also in the evenings after siesta time and she would come to the room at bed time to let some chocolates on the bed. One day we had trouble with our video camera plugs, my son went to the reception desk for a piece of advise and one of the maintenance men was very kind. He showed interest in the problem and provided the right plug. He told my son to keep it which proved to be very useful.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. I wouldn't stay there again if someone paid me. The rooms were not very clean. The carpet had dirt and stains. I always walked around in my shoes because I didn't want to get my feet dirty on the floor. The furniture was also dirty and stained, and very cheap looking. However, the people there were nice, and the food in the restaurant that was connected to the hotel was pretty good.Yes, the location was good, but not only could I hear the music from the elevator playing all night, I could also hear extremely loud noises from outside even though the door to the balcony was not open. I am warning you, DON'T GO HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO STAY IN A DUMP... OR IF YOU ARE DESPERATE AND BROKE.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel good price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very friendly staff real good location close to alot of shops and places to eat clean rooms very safe feeling good hotel taxi's if you go ask for enrique he was alot of help as are taxi driver he would wait for use at locations if we liked and also took use to a very safe indoor market alot nicer than the hotel we stayed at in cancun
